title: Duncan blasts ex-Kotoko skipper, describes him as an attention seeker
text:
Sports News | 14 October 2015 19:40 CET Duncan blasts ex-Kotoko skipper, describes him as an attention seeker - www.ghanasoccernet.com 
David Duncan has blasted former Asante Kotoko captain Joseph Hendricks describing him as an attention seeker for misinterpreting and misrepresenting his thoughts. 
The former Kotoko skipper is on record to have described the gaffer as an arrogant person who always looks down upon his colleagues. 
Hendricks insisted in a radio interview that Duncan described his predecessors’ recruitment as less quality. 
But the Kotoko gaffer has hit back at the ex-skipper insisting he is only seeking for public attention after missing in action for years. 
“… in any case, I think Hendricks is only seeking for attention. I know he has been missing in action for a very long time and he is now trying to alert people that he is still around,” he told GHANAsoccernet.com 
“I know for sure that he is using the Duncan-factor to attract attention for himself. I have never said what he is referring to on any platform. He is only seeking for attention,” he added. 
Duncan has since denied ever saying that the players recruited by his predecessors are not quality players.
